section.title: A Catalogue Of selma'o
section.para: selma'ocross-reference list ofselma'o catalog The following paragraphs list all the selma'o of Lojban, with a brief explanation of what each one is about, and reference to the chapter number where each is explained more fully. As usual, all selma'o names are given in capital letters (with “h” serving as the capital of “'”) and are the names of a representative cmavo, often the most important or the first in alphabetical order. One example is given of each selma'o: for selma'o which have several uses, the most common use is shown.
Specifies a logical connection (e.g. “and”, “or”, “if”), usually between sumti.

interlinear-gloss.natlang: the letter “e” with an acute accent

section.para: Elidable terminator for , , , , or . Marks the end of a mathematical conversion construct.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: li jo'i paboi reboi te'u su'i jo'i ciboi voboi du
interlinear-gloss.gloss: The-number array( one, two ) plus array( three, four) equals

interlinear-gloss.jbo: li jo'i voboi xaboi

section.para: Left discursive parenthesis: allows inserting a digression. Terminated by .

interlinear-gloss.jbo: doi .lisas. mi djica le nu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: O Lisa, I desire the event-of

interlinear-gloss.jbo: … to doi .frank. ko sisti toi do viska le mlatu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: … ( O Frank, [imperative] stop! ) you see the cat.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Lisa, I want you to (Frank! Stop!) see the cat.

section.para: Elidable terminator for . The right discursive parenthesis.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: doi .lisas. mi djica le nu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: O Lisa, I desire the event-of

interlinear-gloss.jbo: … to doi .frank. ko sisti toi do viska le mlatu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: … ( O Frank, [imperative] stop! ) you see the cat.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Lisa, I want you to (Frank! Stop!) see the cat.

section.para: Groups multiple sentences or paragraphs into a logical unit. Terminated by .

interlinear-gloss.jbo: lo xagmau zo'u tu'e ganai cidja gi citno
interlinear-gloss.gloss: Some best : [start] If food, then new.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: … .i ganai vanju gi tolci'o [tu'u]
interlinear-gloss.natlang: As for what is best: if food, then new [is best]; if wine, then old [is best].

section.para: Elidable terminator for . Marks the end of a multiple sentence group.
Particles which indicate the speaker's emotional state or source of knowledge, or the present stage of discourse.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ui la--.djan. cu klama
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Hurrah! John is coming!

section.para: A tense indicating distance in space (near, far, or neither).

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le nanmu va batci le gerku
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Over there the man is biting the dog.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi dunda le cukta [vau] gi'e
lebna lo rupnu vau -- do [vau]

vei ny. su'i pa [ve'o] du

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le verba ve'a
… vi'a cadzu le bisli
interlinear-gloss.natlang: In a medium-sized area, the child walks on the ice.

section.para: Attaches relative clauses or phrases to a whole (possibly connected) sumti, rather than simply to the leftmost portion of the sumti.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la--.frank. e la--.djordj. vu'o noi gidva cu zvati le kumfa
interlinear-gloss.gloss: Frank and George , which are-guides , are-in the room.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Frank and George, who are guides, are in the room.

section.para: The subscript marker: the following number or lerfu string is a subscript for whatever precedes it.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: xy. xi re

section.para: Hesitation noise: content-free, but holds the floor or continues the conversation. It is different from silence in that silence may be interpreted as having nothing more to say.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: doi .y. .y. .djan

section.para: A tense modifier specifying the contour of an event (e.g. beginning, ending, continuing).

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi pu'o damba
interlinear-gloss.natlang: I'm on the verge of fighting.

section.para: A morphological glue word, which joins the two words it stands between into the equivalent of a lujvo.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta xy. zei kantu kacma
interlinear-gloss.natlang: That is an X-ray camera.

section.para: A tense indicating the size of an interval in time (long, medium, or short).

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi pu ze'i citka
interlinear-gloss.natlang: I ate for a little while.

section.para: A tense indicating distance in time (a long, medium or short time ago or in the future).

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi pu zi citka
interlinear-gloss.natlang: I ate a little while ago.

section.para: Joins multiple relative phrases or clauses which apply to the same sumti. Although generally translated with “and”, it is not considered a logical connective.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi ponse pa gerku ku poi blabi
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I own one dog -- such-that it-is-white

interlinear-gloss.jbo: … zi'e noi mi prami ke'a
interlinear-gloss.natlang: I own a dog that is white and which, incidentally, I love.
I own a white dog, which I love.

section.para: Single-word quotation: quotes the following single Lojban word.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: zo si cu lojbo valsi

section.para: Non-Lojban quotation: quotes any text using a delimiting word (which can be any single Lojban word) placed before and after the text. The delimiting word must not appear in the text, and must be separated from the text by pauses.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: zoi .kuuot. Socrates--is--mortal .kuuot. cu glico jufra

section.para: Separates a logical prenex from a bridi or group of sentences to which it applies. Also separates a topic from a comment in topic/comment sentences.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: su'o da poi remna
… ro de poi finpe zo'u da prami de
interlinear-gloss.gloss: … for-all Ys which are-fish : X loves Y
interlinear-gloss.natlang: There is someone who loves all fish.
